ability.title: Subtle Spell
ability.description: When you Cast a Spell, you can spend 1 sorcery point to cast it without any somatic or verbal Components.

ability.title: Quickened Spell
ability.description: When you Cast a Spell that has a Casting Time of 1 action, you can spend 2 sorcery points to change the Casting Time to 1 Bonus Action for this casting.

action.title: Dagger
action.description: Finesse, Light, Thrown (range 20/60)

action.title: Breath Weapon
action.description:
Range: 15' cone
Affected creatures roll Constitution save
DC = 8 + Constitution Mod. + Proficiency Bonus

action.title: Hat of Wizardry
action.description: Try to cast a wizard cantrip, make Arcana check. Once per long rest.

action.title: Wand of Pyrotechnics
action.description:
You can use an action to expend 1 of its charges and create a harmless burst of multicolored light at a point you can see up to 60 feet away. The burst of light is accompanied by a crackling noise that can be heard up to 300 feet away.
The wand regains 1d6 + 1 expended charges daily at dawn (max: 7).
If you expend the wand's last charge, roll a d20. On a 1, the wand erupts in a harmless pyrotechnic display and is destroyed.

inventory.title: Letter from a dead colleague posing a question

action.title: Chill Touch
action.description:
Range: 120'
On a hit, target can't regain hit points. Hit undead: they have disadvantage on attack rolls. Hand clings to target.

action.title: Frostbite
action.description:
Range: 60'
On failed CON save, takes 1d6 cold damage and disadvantage on next weapon attack

action.title: Mage Hand
action.description:
Range: 30' | Duration: 1 minute
You can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial. You can move the hand up to 30 feet each time you use it.

action.title: Minor Illusion
action.description:
Range: 30' | Duration: 1 minute
You create a sound or an image of an object within range that lasts for the duration, or until dismissed as an action. Volume of sound from whisper to scream, can be a voice, one repeating or many sounds. Image must fit in 5' cube. Image cannot create light, sound, touch, or smell. Successful INT (Investigation) check against spell save DC can reveal the illusion.

action.title: Shape Water
action.description:
Range: 30' | Duration: 1 hour
You can manipulate up to a 5' cube of water in range:
- You can instantaneously move or change the flow of the water as you direct, up to 5 feet in any direction.
- You cause the water to form into simple shapes and animate at your direction (1hr).
- You change the water’s color or opacity (1hr).
- You can freeze the water provided there are no creatures in it (1hr).

action.title: Magic Missile
action.description:
Range: 120'
You create darts of magical force, each dart deals the rolled force damage to a creature that you can see in range.
Using higher level spell slots, one more dart for each level >1.

action.title: Ice Spear
action.description:
Range: 120'
You create three spears of ice and hurl them at targets within range. You can hurl them at one target or several.
Make a ranged spell attack for each spear. On a hit, the target takes 2d6 cold damage.
Using higher level spell slots, one more spear for each level >2.

action.title: Invisibility
action.description:
Range: Touch | Duration: Concentration, 1 hour
A creature you touch becomes invisible until the spell ends. Anything the target is wearing or carrying is invisible as long as it is on the target’s person. The spell ends for a target that attacks or casts a spell.
Using higher level spell slots, you can target one additional creature for each level >2.

action.title: Mirror Image
action.description:
Duration: 1 minute
Three illusory duplicates appear in your space. Each time a creature targets you, roll a d20. If you have three duplicates, you must roll a 6 or higher to change the attack's target to a duplicate. With two duplicates, you must roll an 8 or higher. With one duplicate, you must roll an 11 or higher.
DC = 10 + DEX

action.title: Misty Step
action.description: Briefly surrounded by silvery mist, you teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space that you can see.

ability.title: Draconic Bloodline
ability.description: Double Proficiency Bonus to Charisma when talking with Dragons

ability.title: Researcher
ability.description: When you attempt to learn or recall lore, you usually know where the information can be found.

action.title: Psychic Ray
action.description:
Range: 120'
You create three spears of psychic energy and hurl them at targets within range. You can hurl them at one target or several.
Each target makes an INT saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, you deliver 2d6 psychic damage and the target must give up a move, an action, or a bonus action; it gets only two of the three. On a successful save, only takes half damage.
Using higher level spell slots, one more spear for each level >2.

action.title: Detect Magic
action.description:
Range: 30' | Duration: Concentration, 10 minutes
For the duration, you sense the presence of magic within 30 feet of you. If you sense magic in this way, you can use your action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears magic, and you learn its school of magic, if any.
The spell can penetrate most barriers, but it is blocked by 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt.

ability.title: Patient Defense
ability.description: Take the Dodge action as a bonus action on your turn.

ability.title: Step of the Wind
ability.description: Take the Disengage or Dash action as a bonus action on your turn, and your jump distance is doubled for the turn.

action.title: Silent Image
action.description: You create the image of an object, a creature, or some other visible phenomenon that is no larger than a 15-foot cube. The image appears at a spot within range and lasts for the duration. The image is purely visual; it isn't accompanied by sound, smell, or other sensory effects. You can use your action to cause the image to move to any spot within range. As the image changes location, you can alter its appearance so that its movements appear natural for the image. Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, because things can pass through it. A creature that uses its action to examine the image can determine that it is an illusion with a successful Investigation (INT) check against your spell save DC.

action.title: See Invisibility
action.description:
Duration: 1 hour
For the duration, you see invisible creatures and objects as if they were visible, and you can see into the Ethereal Plane.

ability.title: Old Instincts
ability.description: Take an attack of opportunity when an enemy enters range if you didn’t move your legs on previous turn. Or you can choose to trip the enemy - contested DEX check.

ability.title: Trusty Walking Stick
ability.description: Quarterstaff becomes a 1d10 weapon when used two handed (1d8 when used one handed).

action.title: Feather Fall
action.description:
Range: 60' | Duration: 1 minute
Choose up to five falling creatures within range. A falling creature's rate of descent slows to 60 feet per round until the spell ends.

ability.title: Deflect Missiles
ability.description: Reduce ranged weapons damage by 1d10 + DEX + Monk. If damage is zero, spend 1 ki point to throw back (attack w/ proficiency).

action.title: Improved Minor Illusion
action.description:
Range: 30' | Duration: 1 minute
You create a sound and/or an image of an object within range that lasts for the duration, or until dismissed as an action. Volume of sound from whisper to scream, can be a voice, one repeating or many sounds. Image must fit in 5' cube. Image cannot create light, sound, touch, or smell. Successful INT (Investigation) check against spell save DC can reveal the illusion.

action.title: Frozen Sphere (see Fireball)
action.description:
Range: 150'
Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a DEX saving throw. A target takes 8d6 cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 3rd.

action.title: Back you Fiend
action.description: Immediately after any melee attack that uses your quarterstaff you can choose to launch yourself away from your opponent 10 ft, and if the opponent fails a STR saving throw they are knocked back 10 ft.

ability.title: Grumpy Old Man
ability.description: As a bonus action the quarterstaff can be imbued with psychic magic, making it a magical weapon. After a successful attack the magic energy can be released into the target for 2d4 damage. Otherwise lasts 1 minute.

action.title: Way of the Old Master
action.description: Quarterstaff is considered an unarmed attack for Flurry of Blows and Martial attacks.

ability.title: Meditation
ability.description: Regain 1d6 Ki points during a short rest.

ability.title: Who're You Calling Old!?
ability.description: As an action or bonus action, spend 1-4 ki points to make 1-4 attacks. If they target different creatures the creatures must be within 10 feet of each other.

controls.title: 2020/08/27 - Yartar
controls.journal:
We are met by the Shield of Yartar, who escort us into town. The Leader is the Water Baron.
We go to the information desk and learn about the health district, "One Foot On the Boat" Inn, a Cleric convention, and the Barnabus C. Winthrop Library of Business History & Other Things. Gron meets with Krrtck there and they think the bite is a Were-worm curse.
On the Cleric boat, the others talk to Vargis who recommends applying a poultice
Clerics on the boat say to use leeches from somewhere north, the evermores, used for poison
Junt - cleric of Groosh, called everyone else assholes, says he has a better idea, meet him north of town.
Elves: Luvalar, meeting on day two?
Learned how to slow magic with herbs/poultice
Lu meets w/ Luvalar during the night, hears the name "Arasmus" from dying Luvalar after poisoned arrows are shot from across the river.
We meet Groosh at his hut, he sends us all through a fire portal and we fight fire-orcs in some other plane. Killing one gives us a kind of rage ability, but as they get knocked out the remaining foes get stronger, too.

controls.title: 2020/08/08 - Day 7
controls.journal:
We start in the Ice Spires, meet Ryan's goofy worm character Kevin Everyman, travel (magically?) to some woods - very quiet until we notice it's quiet, then the animal sounds begin. We see the town that Lu saw in her vision, and fight a wraith, Lu smashes it no problem with a maul. Go into a dark cave where Kevin says he is from. Then to Eldrin's school (Tools'n'brats). We went to a dwarven settlement where we were led to a cave, out of the cave came a Silver dragon, which after some fighting turned into Gron. Then Kevin Everyman awoke as Osilith, and took us to his "birthplace" where he was created, some sort of weapon against – maybe – Skynet. Gron did a fun crazy monk attack before throwing an unconscious Jolly Jon through a door that Osilith had stepped through.
We traveled to Yartar to hopefully get the worm disease dealt with.

controls.title: 2020/07/29 - Day 6
controls.journal: We take stock of everyone, Steve is OK, one farm hand, Simon, has a worm leg which Jolly Jon cuts off (nat 20!), the other, Billy, is OK. But Jolly Jon, Zoarah, and Hatharal were bit by Bothsworm and so they also have the worm sickness. We explored the caves, found rock rubble, Lu took a staff and went ragey and saw through time, snapped out of it and has a sweet staff now. Back in the main area Gron is trapped in a block of ice, and 4 dragonborn arrive: Hghrron (Gron's mom, and a monk), Krrtck (powerful sorcerer), and Chigh (powerful monk), dunno about the 4th (an extra? Ryan didn't use him). The sorcerer explains about Gron / Patternist, opens a door to "The Shadow of the Pattern".

controls.title: 2020/07/16 - Day 5
controls.journal: We go into the cave. Just outside is a journal that says they were trying to find the cave of seasons. This is that temple - built by dwarves and "keeps the seasons". They heard strange noises under the earth. We went in the well, a path led to a big room. Stone carvings of moon and sun. Found a "berry key" but then fire exploded, we ran out and climbed back out of the well. We go through the caves and found a room with healing water (each drink = d4), and a key at the bottom of the water. In the main room we found Steve tied to a column, and the two farm hands, and 1 dwarf (too far gone). The drawf from episode 1 is half worm - Sir Bothsworm! After we kill him (Zoarah helps) he says "You can kill me, but Osilith will still take this whole world."

controls.title: 2020/06/18 - Day 4
controls.journal:
We left the Dwarven town and go through the southern side of the sword mountains (towards a camp we heard about?). We find a nice arrow, colors are house Marbury. We hear a horn and a pig runs out. Gron conjures a log to make it turn and Jolly Jon smashes it with his maul. We meet Jorn Jonah Marbury, Fenric Marbury (son), and Zoarah Marbury, introduced as his daughter but maybe adopted. Their guide is an Elf named Falcon. We join them to their hunting lodge. Falcon agrees that "Araugauthos" sounds draconic, no other information, no dragon sightings. We stay at the lodge that night, Gron has a dream of a silver *or white* dragon that says "You magic will grow."
The next day we go through the woods an come across a boulder and Gron jumps onto it, it turns out to be a troll and it quickly knocks Gron unconscious, but someone heals him. The troll regenerates but casting Chill Touch stops the regeneration.
At the camp the tents are empty. Gron casts an illusion of a worm to trick Hatharal, and then a wormy arm thing attacks Gron. Hilarious arm battle.

controls.title: 2020/05/28 - Day 3
controls.journal:
A monster appears out of the wall, a shape shifting mass with eyes and teeth and tentacles, and makes the sounds of gnomes it ate. Jon Rogers delt the death blow, and it turned into an orc w/ a hole in its chest, like the first orc. Wears a necklace w/ symbol of Talos, has a map w/ an X on it, and has a note that says "Find the font of magic...Osolith (who?) demands...Araugauthos (dragon name)...". Eldrin gets a 10'  extending pole, Jolly Jon got "Clockwork amulet" (auto roll a 10 instead of rolling a d20 for attack check).
Gron takes a walk and sees the blue dragon again, sees a chain hanging from its neck, one wing is damaged.
Slime analysis: slime from the field is not from the shape shifter. It had sediment that wouldn't be found in a farm field - a mine maybe (flecks of metal).
We run into a group of 4 harpies and almost get wiped out. They have the mark of Talos - maybe there are more orcs in this area. Found a metal spike in the club, worth 10gp, 10 perfect harpy feathers, 2 harpy talons.
We travel to the mushroom-growing dwarves' area and stay in the inn. Jolly Jon pours mushroom oil in Eldrin's drink, to much amusement. The dwarves give us each 15g of "wetshrooms" to try out, let us breathe underwater.

controls.title: 2020/05/07 - Day 2
controls.journal:
Leaving the tower we got away from Daggermaw by casting illusions, which gave Gron and Ludavisia inspiration! We made our way back to Leilon, saw a blue/lightning dragon far away, which is a rare sight. In Leilon, talking to Steve, we learned about dwarves harvesting mushrooms in a town south of Leilon. We visited Wilburton farm and talked to the mom of Billy, in the field there were some misc. shoes, and lots of mucus/slime, and disturbed soil in a roughly circular shape. We learn about Korbaz in Gnomengaard who might know about the slime.
We travel to Gnomengaard and meet Morbo at the entrance. Korbaz is locked away in the throne room, Morbo recommends we talk to Fibbelstib and Dabbledob.
A gnome attacks us w/ a turret, we meet Factoray. We explored Gnomengaard, got past spinning blades, met lots of gnomes, they think there's a shape shifter hiding somewhere. In the throne room we open a chest and took a Hat of Wizardry and a Wand of Pyrotechnics, which are are allowed to borrow. One of the Kings (Korbaz or Nerkley) says the rug grew teeth and tried to attack him.

controls.title: 2020/04/23 - Day 1
controls.journal:
We start in the Slumbering Bear Inn, in Leilon. Janelle is the bartender. Sir Botswane the Dwarf is there (red beard, badass).
Steve invites us to the town hall for quests. There's an apothecary and a church.
Quests:
• Shipwrecks - eerie light, 4 ships gone
• Disappearing people (~12 people)
• Goblins messed up some caravans, maybe there's loot.
We chose the shipwrecks/lighthouse. At the apothecary is Grolk, a half-orc. Looking for Witchwort, grompstool, and honeylight.
On the road we ran into Harris and Beardsley from the Hogs Mead Brewery.
At the lighthouse we met Halfred the crab, learned about Marrol the elf and Daggermaw the shark. Jolly Jon tried to attack Marrol's ghost form, Gron settled her down, Marrol lost her arcane focus, we should find it. We got lightning power from an altar to Talos, fought harpies, rested, and fought Muesko the orc necromancer, who had a hole in his chest. We found "Hasselhommer" and "Cloak of Many Fashions". Ships that were damaged: "Golden Gull, Orca"
